intro: Petunga rufidula, commonly known as the red-stemmed petunga, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, while the stems are reddish in color, giving it its common name. Petunga rufidula produces small yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators.
